name: Pajeon (Spring Onon Pancake)
author: Madhur Jaffrey
source: A Taste of the Far East, pg.114
ingredients:
- 85g rice flour
- 85g plain flour
- 1 tsp sesame oil
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 3 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 large egg, beaten
- 6 spring onions, quartered lengthways then cut int 3" segments
- Korean dipping sauce
instructions:
- Put the 2 flours into a bowl and slowly add 250ml water, mixing as you go until you have a smooth batter with the consistency of cream.
- Add the sesame oil and salt and mix.
- Add the egg and mix.
- Cover and set the batter aside for 30 minutes.

- Pour 1 tbsp of the vegetable oil into a frying pan over medium-low heat.
- When hot, scatter 1/3 of the spring onion evenly on the bottom of the pan and pour 1/3 of the batter over, making a 20cm pancake.
- Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
- Turn the pancake over, cover and cook for another 3 minutes.
- Uncover, and cook for another 2 minutes. The pancake should be lightly browned in spots.

- Repeat twice more with the remaining ingredients, and cut into 2" squares. Serve hot with Korean dipping sauce.
